Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: クレア
Entry.EnglishText: Claire

Entry.JapaneseText: 傭兵
Entry.EnglishText: Mercenary

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア兵
Entry.EnglishText: Callegean Soldier

Entry.JapaneseText: おばあさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>、おまえにとって 大切なものってなんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>, what do you consider to be most precious to you?

Entry.JapaneseText: えっ、私の……？ そ、それは……家族だとか…… 好きな人だとか……？
Entry.EnglishText: Huh, me? Well, something like my family... Or perhaps someone that I love...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 家族……好きな人、か……
Entry.EnglishText: Family... Someone you love...

Entry.JapaneseText: 大切なものを失うと聞いた時、 ふと、ミルハウストの事を 思い出した……
Entry.EnglishText: When I was warned about losing someone precious to me, the first thing that came to mind was Milhaust.

Entry.JapaneseText: えっ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Huh...?

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア城で<Agarte>が消えた時、 あいつは泣いていた。
Entry.EnglishText: When <Agarte> went missing at Callegea Castle, he started crying.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……女王がいなくなれば 臣民は哀しむものでしょう？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Is it not natural for a Queen's subjects to mourn her passing?

Entry.JapaneseText: オレにはそういうのはわからない。 だが……あいつのそれは…… もっと違うものに思えた。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not the best person to ask about that. But... I do think it was different for him.

Entry.JapaneseText: 違うもの……？
Entry.EnglishText: Different?

Entry.JapaneseText: つまり…… おまえの言う家族とか…… 好きな人とかを失った……
Entry.EnglishText: Well, like you were saying, it seemed like he had lost a member of his family... Or even the woman he loved.

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか……そんなわけ…… ないわ……
Entry.EnglishText: No, that...can't be...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうして、そう思うんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: What makes you say that?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……だ、だって……彼は、 「あなたとは違いすぎる」って……
Entry.EnglishText: Because... He once said to her, "You and I are too different."

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、そのわた……いえ…… 女王様はガジュマの姿のままでは ダメなんだって……それで……
Entry.EnglishText: He couldn't be with m-...er, the Queen, because she was a Gajuma. So then...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……？ 種族が違うから、 好きになれない……って事か？ あいつがそんな事を……？
Entry.EnglishText: ...? You mean he couldn't be in love with her because they weren't the same race? He really said something like that?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……もし仮にあなたが大切な人に…… 同じ事を言われたら……どうする？
Entry.EnglishText: ...If you were to be told the same thing by someone you held dear, then what would you do?

Entry.JapaneseText: どうする……と言われても……
Entry.EnglishText: Well, I've never had to think about something like that...

Entry.JapaneseText: オレは受け入れてもらった…… こんな違う自分でも…… おじさんやおばさん…… それに……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm different from them in so many ways, and yet, Mr. and Mrs. Bennett still accepted me... And also...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたの……？
Entry.EnglishText: What's the matter?

Entry.JapaneseText: いや……
Entry.EnglishText: It's nothing.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あなたは幸せなのね……
Entry.EnglishText: ...You have lived a blessed life...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Claire>？
Entry.EnglishText: ...<Claire>?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……い、いえ…… なんでもないの…… ゴメンなさい……
Entry.EnglishText: N-Never mind. It's nothing. I'm sorry.

Entry.JapaneseText: 二人とも、こんなところにいたのか。 心配したぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: So this is where you two went. I was worried about you.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>……
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>...

Entry.JapaneseText: あまり安全とは言えない街だ。 不用意に出歩くのは感心できんな。
Entry.EnglishText: This town isn't what you'd call safe, so I can't say that I approve of you running off so carelessly.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……すまない。
Entry.EnglishText: My bad.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……何があったんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: What's going on?

Entry.JapaneseText: 行ってみよう。
Entry.EnglishText: We'd better go find out.

Entry.JapaneseText: 彼は……ミルハウストは 「あなたとは違いすぎる」…… ガジュマの姿のままでは ダメなんだって……それで……
Entry.EnglishText: He... Milhaust had said "You and I are too different." He couldn't be with her because she was a Gajuma. So then...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……？ 種族が違うから、 好きになれない……って事か？ あいつがそんな事を……？
Entry.EnglishText: ...? You mean he couldn't be in love with her because they weren't the same race? He really said something like that?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……もし仮にあなたが大切な人に…… 同じ事を言われたら……どうする？
Entry.EnglishText: ...If you were to be told the same thing by someone you held dear, then what would you do?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマだとかガジュマだとか…… そんなに大事な事なのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Huma, Gajuma, does something like that really matter?

Entry.JapaneseText: ええ、大事だと思うわ。 ヒューマに愛されるためには、 ヒューマの身体が必要なのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, I believe it's important. In order to be loved by a Huma, you need the body of a Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: クレア……変わったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Claire... You've changed.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてそんな事言うの？ 私は私……クレアよ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: Why would you say such a thing? I am me... I'm Claire!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……おまえは、オレの知っている クレアじゃない……
Entry.EnglishText: You aren't the Claire that I know.

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃあ、私は誰なの!? 誰だと言うの!?
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, then just who am I?! Who do you think I am?!

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ…… おまえはアガーテだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Agarte... You're Agarte!

Entry.JapaneseText: やめて!! 私はクレアよ…… この目も鼻も唇も、この声も…… 全部、私のものじゃないの!? ……私はクレアよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Stop it! I'm Claire... These eyes, nose, lips... even this voice... Do they not all belong to me?! I'm Claire!!

Entry.JapaneseText: わたくしは<Claire>よ!! <Claire>よ!!
Entry.EnglishText: I'm Claire! Claire!!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマのお家は、この先だ。 よそ者だったら、さっさと消えな。
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma live just up ahead. If you're not from around here, then scram.

Entry.JapaneseText: オレたちはスカラベさんに 雇われた傭兵さ。
Entry.EnglishText: We're mercenaries hired by Mr. Scarabe.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大事な労働力が逃げたり 暴れたりしないようにする この街の番人ってわけだ。
Entry.EnglishText: In other words, we're here to guard this town and make sure its valuable workforce doesn't run off or riot.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマがウロウロするな。 さっさと橋の向こうへ行け！
Entry.EnglishText: This is no place for a Gajuma to be loitering. Get your ass across the bridge!

Entry.JapaneseText: 橋の向こうへは行くなよ。 ガジュマどもの様子が なんだかおかしいからな。
Entry.EnglishText: I advise you not to cross this bridge. Those Gajuma have been acting strange lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: ふん、この街のガジュマとは 違って小奇麗なおっさんだな。
Entry.EnglishText: Hmph, you look much better dressed than the Gajuma from around here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 少しはヤツらに金でも 恵んでやったらどうだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Why don't you go give them some money?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマには気をつけろよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Careful around those Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマと交渉ね…… 何を話すんだか……
Entry.EnglishText: Negotiations with Gajuma, huh... I wonder what they'll be talking about...

Entry.JapaneseText: スカラベさんが、簡単に ガジュマの言う事なんか 聞くワケねえと思うけどな。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't think Mr Scarabe would hear them out so easily, though.

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、明日になればわかるさ。 あんたらもさっさと宿屋に帰って、 明日に備えな。
Entry.EnglishText: Well, we'll know tomorrow. You guys better go back to your rooms so you can be prepared.

Entry.JapaneseText: 先日、ラジルダで暴動を鎮圧したが、 ここもひどい状況だな。
Entry.EnglishText: We had to put down a riot in Razilda the other day. This place is just as bad.

Entry.JapaneseText: 心なしか、地面も揺れているようだ。 そこの川の魚も、見かけない。
Entry.EnglishText: The ground here seems to be shaking a bit. I'm not seeing any fish in the river, either.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何が起こるかわからない。 十分、注意するんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: There's no telling what might happen. Be on your guard.

Entry.JapaneseText: 先日、ラジルダで暴動を鎮圧したが、 ここもひどい状況だな。
Entry.EnglishText: We had to put down a riot in Razilda the other day. This place is just as bad.

Entry.JapaneseText: おい、ガジュマ！ この街のもんじゃないようだが、 ヘタな騒ぎを起こすんじゃないぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, Gajuma! You don't seem to be from around here, but you better not cause any trouble!

Entry.JapaneseText: この街には、俺たちみたいな 傭兵があちこちにいるからな。 ガジュマの大嫌いな傭兵がな！
Entry.EnglishText: This town has a lot of mercenaries like us who REALLY hate Gajuma in it, after all!

Entry.JapaneseText: この先はガジュマの地域だぜ。 小汚い野良犬みてえな ガジュマしかいないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Just beyond that bridge is the Gajuma sector. Nothing but tramps over there.

Entry.JapaneseText: おい、どっから来た？ ガジュマは橋の向こうへ行け！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, where'd you come from? Go back across that bridge where you belong!

Entry.JapaneseText: おお、おまえの連れの娘、 カワイイじゃねえか。 まったく、うらやましいヤツだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, that girl you're with... She's cute. I'm so jealous of you, man!

Entry.JapaneseText: 話しかけるんじゃねえ！ 橋の向こうに行くか、 おとなしく街から出て行きな！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't talk to me! Go over the bridge and leave town without a fuss!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとつるむなんてよ、 せっかくの彼女にガジュマの ニオイが付いちまうぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: If you hang out with Gajuma, then your girlfriend is gonna start smelling like them to!

Entry.JapaneseText: ケッ、交渉だと……？ ガジュマがヒューマに何を お願いするつもりだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Tch, "negotiations"...? What do Gajuma want from Huma, anyway?

Entry.JapaneseText: 人権を無視するなってか？ ケッ、くだらねぇ……
Entry.EnglishText: What, they think they're being denied their rights or something? What a load of crap...

Entry.JapaneseText: スカラベ様も、余計な事を 決めてくれたもんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Scarabe really didn't need to agree to a discussion with those Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ただでさえ、偉そうなガジュマが、 もっと調子づくじゃねえかよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Now those Gajuma are gonna act even more self-righteous...

Entry.JapaneseText: クレアというヒューマの娘を 見かけたら、すぐに軍まで 伝えてほしい。
Entry.EnglishText: Please tell the army immediately if you see a Huma girl named Claire.

Entry.JapaneseText: 遠鳴りが聞こえる…… 東のほうからか……？
Entry.EnglishText: I hear rumbling in the distance... I think it's coming from the east?

Entry.JapaneseText: 住民たちは、 広場に避難している。
Entry.EnglishText: Civilians are taking refuge in the plaza.

Entry.JapaneseText: 現在は、この橋を挟んで ヒューマとガジュマを分けているが、 将来的には、元の家に戻れるように 軍主導で復興を進める予定だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Currently this bridge separates Gajuma and Huma, but in the future, the military plans to lead the way in reconstruction efforts so that people may return to their original homes.

Entry.JapaneseText: 家の前でガジュマに ウロウロされちゃあ 迷惑だよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Stop loitering in front of my house, Gajuma! You're being a nuisance!

Entry.JapaneseText: ホラ、その橋の向こうが あんたらガジュマの住むべき 場所だよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You Gajuma belong on the other side of the bridge!

Entry.JapaneseText: さっさとお仲間の ところへ行きな。
Entry.EnglishText: Go on, hurry to your fellow Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたたち、ガジュマを 連れてうろうろするなんて どういうつもりだい？
Entry.EnglishText: What are you doing wandering around here with a Gajuma in tow?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマと一緒にいたいなら、 橋の向こうへ行っとくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you like being around Gajuma so much, then go across the bridge.

Entry.JapaneseText: 見かけない顔だね！ どっから来たのか知らないけど、 ガジュマは橋の向こうへ行きな。
Entry.EnglishText: Now you're an unfamiliar face! I have no idea where you came from, but Gajuma belong across that bridge.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたの連れの娘さん、 ほんとにキレイな子だねえ。
Entry.EnglishText: That girl you're with is really pretty.

Entry.JapaneseText: スカラベ様ご自慢の スージーお嬢様に 負けないくらいだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Her beauty rivals that of Lord Scarabe's dearest daughter, Susie!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたのお連れさん、 とっても可愛いねえ。
Entry.EnglishText: Your companion is really pretty.

Entry.JapaneseText: スカラベ様のお嬢さんみたいに さらわれたりしなかったかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Was she kidnapped like Lord Scarabe's daughter was?

Entry.JapaneseText: あんた、ヒューマの二人が、 せっかくいい雰囲気だったのに、 まったくガジュマは 気が利かないね……！
Entry.EnglishText: Your two Huma companions were having such a good time, but like always a Gajuma has to ruin things...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんた、ガジュマなんかを 連れて歩くから、せっかくの 場面に水を差されるんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: How could you let that Gajuma ruin your moment with your girl?!

Entry.JapaneseText: よく考えなさい！
Entry.EnglishText: Have some shame!

Entry.JapaneseText: あのスカラベ様が、ガジュマと お話をしてくださるんだよ。 あんたらガジュマは感謝しなよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Lord Scarabe is holding a discussion with Gajuma. You should be grateful!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが何を話したいのか 知らないけど、スカラベ様は 一筋縄じゃいかないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I have no clue what the Gajuma want to talk about, but whatever it is, Lord Scarabe is not one to be easily swayed.

Entry.JapaneseText: とにかく、明日まで ゆっくり待つしかないねえ。
Entry.EnglishText: I guess we'll just have to wait until tomorrow.

Entry.JapaneseText: あたし、覚えてるよ…… この橋を通って行った あのガジュマの娘が……
Entry.EnglishText: I remember seeing a Gajuma girl cross this bridge...

Entry.JapaneseText: あれが女王様だったなんて…… あたしは悪い事は 何にもしてないよ……
Entry.EnglishText: So she was the Queen... I didn't do anything wrong, all right...

Entry.JapaneseText: あ、あんたのお連れさんは…… 女王様じゃないのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Th-That girl with you... She's not the Queen, is she?

Entry.JapaneseText: 違うのかい……？ 良く似てるけど……
Entry.EnglishText: She isn't? But she looks just like her...

Entry.JapaneseText: ミルハウスト様は、ガジュマを 平等に扱わない者は罰するって 言ってたけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Sir Milhaust said that those who don't treat Gajuma as equals would be punished, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 街には街のやり方が あるんだから……ねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: That's just how we do things around here...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あたしはガジュマを 差別してたわけじゃないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I wasn't discriminating against Gajuma, all right...

Entry.JapaneseText: た、ただ……別の種族として、 別々に暮らしたほうがいいって 思ってただけさ……
Entry.EnglishText: I-It's just that... I-I thought that it would be better for the two races to live separately...

Entry.JapaneseText: あ、あんたのお連れさんは…… 女王様じゃないのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Th-That girl with you... She's not the Queen, is she?

Entry.JapaneseText: 違うのかい……？ 良く似てるけど……
Entry.EnglishText: She isn't? But she looks just like her...

Entry.JapaneseText: ミルハウスト様は、ガジュマを 平等に扱わない者は罰するって 言ってたけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Sir Milhaust said that those who don't treat Gajuma as equals would be punished, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 街には街のやり方が あるんだから……ねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: That's just how we do things around here...

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバってお偉いさんは、 ヒューマがガジュマを 苦しめてるって言ったそうだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: An official in this country named Zilva said that Huma are causing trouble for Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: あたしたちヒューマは ガジュマに暮らす場所も 仕事も与えてやったんだ。 何も悪くないよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: We Huma are the ones who provide shelter and employment for Gajuma! We've done nothing wrong!

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバとかいう役人さんは、 ヒューマを差別するような 事を言ったそうじゃないか。
Entry.EnglishText: Didn't that official named Zilva say some discriminatory things about Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: ミルハウスト様は、 そういう人には、何も言って くださらないのかねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: Doesn't Sir Milhaust have anything to say to people like her...?

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたたちガジュマの 本音が見えて来たよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've finally figured out what you Gajuma really think...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマを見下してたのは、 あんたたちガジュマだったんだ。 私は負けやしないよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: You're the ones who look down on us Huma! I won't allow myself to be subjugated...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマはヒューマと戦って この国を乗っ取るつもりなんだよ。 もう戦うしかないよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma have turned against us Huma in a plot to take over the country! We have no choice but to fight...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 年寄りだからって、 バカにするんじゃないよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Don't make fun of me just because I'm old!

Entry.JapaneseText: ちゃんと聞こえてるんだからね、 その辺の草むらで、ネコが グルグル言ってる事くらい……！
Entry.EnglishText: I can hear you just fine! Heck, I can even hear a cat purring in the grass over there!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマはヒューマと戦って この国を乗っ取るつもりなんだよ。 もう戦うしかないよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma have turned against us Huma in a plot to take over the country! We have no choice but to fight...!

Entry.JapaneseText: な、何が起こったってね…… 私はガジュマなんかに頼ったり しないんだよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: N-No matter what happens, I'm not going to rely on the help of Gajuma...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは賢いんだ。 頭を使えば、どんな事だって 乗り越えられるんだよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: We Huma are wise! So long as we use our heads, we'll be able to get through anything!

Entry.JapaneseText: 何が起きたって、最後に 生き残るのはヒューマだよ。 ヒューマなんだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: No matter what happens, we Huma will be the last ones standing!

Entry.JapaneseText: 無粋なガジュマには 心は許せないね。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll never forgive you vulgar Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたらも こんな愚鈍なガジュマと 一緒にいる事ないんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: There's no reason for you to be traveling with that stupid Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No
